pullRequest.title: Amqp Message Update - API Change
pullRequest.bodyText:
Design decisions:

Use one type to support Data, SEQUENCE, VALUE
We will use AmqpMessageBody for this.

This PR has changes in Amqp Message API based on various discussion and changes in dotnet API.
Since we have released Amqp Message API  core-amqp in 1.6.0 GA.  Following are breaking API update


New AmqpMessageId ( Based on discussion from Clemens, dotnet had)


New AmqpAddress ( Based on discussion from Clemens, dotnet had)


Return type change in AmqpMessageProperties  for above two new types.


Following changes are to keep consistency with dotnet and common prefix -> AmqpMessage


Renamed AmqpDataBody to AmqpMessageBody (to be same name as in dotnet)


Renamed AmqpBodyType to AmqpMessageBodyType (Same name in dotnet)


Added AmqpMessageBody .getFirstData () Based on team review


Returning IterableStream in AmqpMessageBody .getData () Based on team review


Removed Copy constructor AmqpAnnotatedMessage (matching with dotnet) and because it is servicebus specific . So moving this logic into servicebus


Note: Having prefix AmqpMessage in all the Amqp type will help to bind all the types with one prefix.
dotnet : https://apiview.dev/Assemblies/Review/150b1bb087774addafaac6f04f00cdc5#Azure.Core.Amqp.AmqpMessageBody
Java API VIew : https://apiview.dev/Assemblies/Review/30680d3c215c4312a14e787044475bc9
fixes #17080

nodes.bodyText: Can we add a little more information in the doc about what this address is? Also, link the AMQP spec to all these AMQP types because a lot of the model contents are dictated by the spec. So, we should have more descriptive docs.

nodes.bodyText: This check is unnecessary as the AmqpAnnotatedMessage instance can only be created with a non-null body.
These should be documented in javadoc @throws section.

I guess we should make this javadoc crisp on why we do this. For the customer, this decision seems arbitrary and we need to document the justification for doing this. This, as we discussed earlier, has the potential for dropping data that is sent from another client that does support more than one byte[].

commit.message: Rev API changes for body type rename
Added API based on review comments

This error is copy / pasted in many places - please review all docs for similar typos.

This kind of error message only serves to confuse users. It is better to say that the type is not supported at present and that it will be available in future releases. Perhaps even going so far as to point to a pre-filed github issue so that users may find more or subscribe.
you can call getFirstData now, can't you?
Will service bus never support the other AmqpMessageId formats and will only ever support String?
I don't think copy is required here. Even if we did this for immutability, we'll have to do this again in getter methods which we are currently not doing. So, just copying here isn't useful.
Yeah, this can either use body.getFirstData() or body.getData().iterator().next(). No need to use optional.

Suggested change

nodes.bodyText: The javadoc for overridden methods is inconsistent. hashCode has no javadoc, equals has @inheritdoc and toString has custom documentation. We should have consistent doc here.
These links should be on AmqpMessageBodyType instead.
I don't think we should have information about future releases in this JavaDoc. It should instead be a GitHub issue tracked in our backlog.
This can be made private as it's not required by any other class within the package.
If the message ids support string, long, uuid and binary types why does the constructor only have String?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,70 @@ +// Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved. +// Licensed under the MIT License. + +package com.azure.core.amqp.models; + +import java.util.Objects; + +/** + * This represents Message id. Amqp specification support message id in various types. This class only implements + * {@link String} representation at present. + * + *

Create and retrieve message id

+ * {@codesnippet com.azure.core.amqp.models.AmqpBodyType.checkBodyType} + * + * Amqp message id types: + *
    + *
  • String
    • + *
  • long
    • + *
  • Uuid
    • + *
  • binary

nodes.bodyText: Just noting that we don't make a copy in .NET.
Why do we not copy here, but do in the AmqpMessage ctor?

nit: upper-case 'C'
nit: 'supports', not 'support'
Why are you copying the byte[] here?
"support body type [%s] at present" -> "supports the AMQP Data body type at present"
Why did you stop copying here?
nit: these new lines under the if statement in various places look out of place.

If the common case is to have users call this getFirstData API, we shouldn't wrap into a collection and call get(0) on it, as it is just extra work. We should only wrap the first time the getData call is made, and keep it as a byte[] otherwise.

I'm curious, what are the repercussions of a user doing this:
messageBody = amqpAnnotatedMessage.getBody();
Put another way...this code is demonstrating how to switch off the body type, but to me it raises questions about what it is actually demonstrating, and what the real use case is.
It would be good to clarify to the user in this sample code and / or Java why the code I put above is wrong, because I would guess that most people would do that by default.

So the Service Bus APIs will continue to be String-only forever? @hemanttanwar Can you provide sample code on how this would be done (either today or in the future) for Java using the approach Josh shares above?
